column4: im now installing clean install 9.10 updating and a window pops up Configuring grub-pc what would you like to do about grub? keep the local version currently installed ? install the package maintainer's version?
What's on your computer now?
xubuntu
Are you replacing it, or installing ubuntu in another partition?
but that doesnt change anything. question is about grub. its clean install and just downloaded 146 mb of updates and updates are installing
im installing xubuntu 9.10 on sda and sdb has windows
OK, you're confusing me.  You said you already have xubuntu on your computer.
yes i put xubuntu 3h ago and put updates
So are you now trying to do a clean install over the existing install, or installing it in a different partition?
i installed xubuntu on sdb. before installing i deleted whole partition
I'm asking a straightforward question and you're not answering it.
so its clean install
OK, install the package maintainer's version
ok thx dj_segfault1. and is theres some situation when i should choose other? how to know that? maybe maintainers version is always better since its newer?
Does the window mention menu.lst?
no.
That doesn't make sense.  Can you repost the exact message?  If you are installing in a clean partition, there's no installed version to conflict with.
its asking about grub-pc
I'm sorry I missed that.  Never heard of it before.
!grub2
!grub
I know what grub2 is, but what is grub-pc?
grub2 package name is grub-pc
